links.title: List Rate Limits
links.description: List the rate limits on a zone.

per_page.description: Maximum number of results per page. This can only be provided as 1 or in multiples of 5 such as 5, 10, 15 or 20

links.title: Create Rate Limit
links.description: Create a new rate limit for a zone. See the record object definitions for required attributes for each record type
links.curl:
curl -X POST "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/023e105f4ecef8ad9ca31a8372d0c353/rate_limits" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: user@example.com" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     --data '{"id":"372e67954025e0ba6aaa6d586b9e0b59","disabled":false,"description":"Prevent multiple login failures to mitigate brute force attacks","match":{"request":{"methods":["GET","POST"],"schemes":["HTTP","HTTPS"],"url":"*.example.org/path*"},"response":{},"headers":[{"name":"Cf-Cache-Status","op":"ne","value":"HIT"}]},"bypass":[{"name":"url","value":"api.example.com/*"}],"threshold":60,"period":900,"action":{"mode":"challenge","timeout":86400,"response":{"content_type":"text/xml","body":"<error>This request has been rate-limited.</error>"}}}'

disabled.description: Whether this ratelimit is currently disabled

description.example: "Prevent multiple login failures to mitigate brute force attacks"
description.description: A note that you can use to describe the reason for a rate limit. This value is sanitized and all tags are removed

methods.description: HTTP Methods, can be a subset ['POST','PUT'] or all ['_ALL_'].  This field is not required to create a rate limit rule.

items.description: HTTP Method, or '_ALL_' to indicate all methods

schemes.description: HTTP Schemes, can be one ['HTTPS'], both ['HTTP','HTTPS'] or all ['_ALL_'].  This field is not required.

items.description: HTTP Scheme, or '_ALL_' to indicate all schemes

url.description: The URL pattern to match comprised of the host and path, i.e. example.org/path*. Normalisation is applied before the pattern is matched. Wildcard * are expanded to match applicable traffic, query strings are not matched. Use `*` for all traffic to your zone.

origin_traffic.description: Only count traffic that has come from your origin servers. If `true`, cached items that Cloudflare serve will not count towards rate limiting.  This field is not required.
origin_traffic.cfNotes: Deprecated, please use response headers instead and also provide `origin_traffic:false` to avoid legacy behaviour interacting with the response.headers property.

name.description: The name of the response header to match

op.description: The operator when matching, eq means equals, ne means not equals

value.description: The value of the header, which will be exactly matched

match.description: Determines which traffic the rate limit counts towards the threshold

bypass.title: Bypass rate limit when
bypass.description: Criteria that would allow the rate limit to be bypassed, for example to express that you shouldn't apply a rate limit to a given set of URLs

threshold.description: The threshold that triggers the rate limit mitigations, combine with period. i.e. threshold per period

period.description: The time in seconds to count matching traffic. If the count exceeds threshold within this period the action will be performed

mode.description: The type of action to perform.

timeout.description: The time in seconds as an integer to perform the mitigation action. Must be the same or greater than the period.
timeout.cfNotes: If `mode` is `challenge`, `managed_challenge` or `js_challenge` then the Zone Challenge Passage time is used and this value should not be supplied.

content_type.description: The content-type of the body, must be one of: `text/plain`, `text/xml`, `application/json`

body.description: The body to return, the content here should conform to the content_type

response.description: Custom content-type and body to return, this overrides the custom error for the zone.  This field is not required.  Omission will result in default HTML error page.
response.cfNotes: If `mode` is `challenge`, `managed_challenge` or `js_challenge` then the Zone challenge pages are used and this object should not be supplied.

action.description: The action to be performed when the threshold of matched traffic within the period defined is exceeded

links.title: Rate Limit Details
Update Rate Limit
links.curl:
curl -X PUT "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/023e105f4ecef8ad9ca31a8372d0c353/rate_limits/372e67954025e0ba6aaa6d586b9e0b59" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: user@example.com" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     --data '{"id":"372e67954025e0ba6aaa6d586b9e0b59","disabled":false,"description":"Prevent multiple login failures to mitigate brute force attacks","match":{"request":{"methods":["GET","POST"],"schemes":["HTTP","HTTPS"],"url":"*.example.org/path*"},"response":{},"headers":[{"name":"Cf-Cache-Status","op":"ne","value":"HIT"}]},"bypass":[{"name":"url","value":"api.example.com/*"}],"threshold":60,"period":900,"action":{"mode":"challenge","timeout":86400,"response":{"content_type":"text/xml","body":"<error>This request has been rate-limited.</error>"}}}'

cfLinkErrors.10002: Rate limit not unique (edit the existing rather than adding a new)
cfLinkErrors.10015: Patch value not valid for given context

object_definition.title: Rate Limits for a Zone
